intro: Erysimum chamaephyton, commonly known as the rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. Its yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. Erysimum chamaephyton is adapted to harsh conditions and is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia.
